missionPlanner.title: Mission Planner (SORA / PDRA / STS)
missionPlanner.description: Submit SORA 2.0/2.5, PDRA or STS operation details and inspect the assessment result (GRC â†’ ARC â†’ SAIL â†’ TMPR â†’ OSO â†’ Risk).

results.title: Result
results.noResult: No result yet. Submit a SORA assessment above.

categoryNotes.STS-01: STS-01 provides only final values: GRC_3, ARC_b, SAIL II
categoryNotes.STS-02: STS-02: Final equals Initial GRC (3). ARC_b. SAIL II
categoryNotes.PDRA-S01: Per PDRA-S01 table: Final GRC_3, ARC_b, SAIL II
categoryNotes.PDRA-S02: Per PDRA-S02 table: Final GRC_3, ARC_b, SAIL II
categoryNotes.PDRA-G01: Per PDRA-G01 table: Final GRC_3, ARC_b, SAIL II
categoryNotes.PDRA-G02: Reserved/segregated airspace: ARC_a. Final GRC_3, SAIL II
categoryNotes.PDRA-G03: Linear inspections near obstacles: ARC_a. Final GRC_3, SAIL II

help.explicitARC: Choose ARC if you know it; otherwise keep Auto to derive per SORA rules.

airspaceControl.title: Select whether the airspace is controlled (ATC) or uncontrolled.
airspaceControl.controlled: Controlled airspace with ATC services (Class A-E). Reduces collision risk.
airspaceControl.uncontrolled: Uncontrolled airspace (Class G). Higher air risk - requires more mitigations.

locationType.title: Airport or other location.
locationType.airport: Near or at airport - High air traffic risk. Requires coordination.
locationType.nonAirport: Away from airports - Lower air traffic.

environment.title: Select the operating environment per SORA 2.5 Step #4.
environment.urban: Urban - High population density (>1,500 people/kmÂ²). High traffic. Requires GRC mitigation.
environment.suburban: Suburban - Medium population (500-1,500 people/kmÂ²). Moderate traffic density.
environment.rural: Rural - Low population (<500 people/kmÂ²). Low traffic. Easier GRC compliance.
environment.industrial: Industrial - Controlled area with restricted access. May reduce ground risk.
environment.remote: Remote/Desert - Very low population (<5 people/kmÂ²). Minimal ground/air risk.
environment.coastal: Coastal/Maritime - Over water or coastline. Reduced ground risk if over water.
environment.mountain: Mountain - Low traffic, terrain obstacles. Weather and emergency landing challenges.
environment.forest: Forest - Low traffic, natural obstacles. Limited emergency landing options.

help.typicality: Is the flight typical or atypical for the area?
help.maxHeightAGL: Maximum height above ground level in meters.
help.isAtypicalSegregated: Is the area atypically segregated for this flight (NOTAM/TFR)?

populationDensity.controlled: Controlled ground area with access management.
populationDensity.5: Very remote area: < 5 people per kmÂ².
populationDensity.500: Sparsely populated / light residential: < 500 people per kmÂ².
populationDensity.5000: Suburban / low density metro: < 5,000 people per kmÂ².
populationDensity.50000: High density metropolitan: < 50,000 people per kmÂ².
populationDensity.50001: Assemblies of people: > 50,000 people per kmÂ².

aerodromeProximity.note: For SORA 2.5 we use kilometers (km) for aerodrome proximity.

oso_1_desc: The UAS operator is competent and has demonstrated capability. Ref: JARUS SORA v2.5 Table 14.
oso_2_desc: UAS manufactured by an entity with appropriate competence and quality assurance.
oso_3_desc: Maintenance performed by competent entity following documented procedures.
oso_4_desc: Critical components designed according to applicable aviation design standards (ADS).
oso_5_desc: System safety assessment performed and risks mitigated appropriately.
oso_6_desc: Command, Control and Communications (C3) link robust and appropriate for operation.
oso_7_desc: Configuration conformity verification prior to flight.
oso_8_desc: Documented operational procedures, normal/abnormal/emergency, aligned with the CONOPS.
oso_9_desc: Remote pilots and observers trained, qualified and current for the operation.
oso_13_desc: External services (e.g., GNSS, telecom, MET) identified and performance adequate.
oso_16_desc: Crew resource management and coordination practices implemented.
oso_17_desc: Fitness for duty checks (fatigue, alcohol, medical) and duty time limits in place.
oso_18_desc: Design features protect against common operator errors and mode confusion.
oso_19_desc: Procedures and design ensure safe recovery from foreseeable errors and failures.
oso_20_desc: Humanâ€“Machine Interface suitable for task load and provides clear feedback/alerts.
oso_23_desc: Operating envelope and environmental limits defined, briefed and respected.
oso_24_desc: UAS equipment and procedures qualified for foreseeable adverse environmental conditions.
